properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blowing snow is expected of much of the Manitoba Lakes tonight. Blowing snow will diminish on Friday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T06:03:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T14:04:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2229678052.2021
Area: Lake Winnipegosis, Lake Winnipeg - north basin, Lake Manitoba
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain, which fell overnight, has now changed over to snow. Total snowfall amounts in excess of 10 cm are expected before the precipitation tapers off later this evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T04:24:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-15T01:26:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1770953717.2021
Area: The Pas Cormorant Westray and Wanless, North and South Moose Lake incl. Moose Lake Res., Snow Lake and Herb Lake Landing, Flin Flon Cranberry Portage and Grass River Prov. Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and rain on tap for the weekend Significant snowfall amounts are expected on Saturday and Sunday. Snowfall amounts could locally reach 15 centimetres. However, the snowfall could be interrupted by a period of rain late in the day on Saturday. Quickly accumulating snow could make travel difficult. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T12:32:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T20:33:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2330446994.2021

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A frontal system approaching the northern Alaskan Panhandle will spread snow to the South Klondike Highway beginning this afternoon. Snow will intensify in the wake of the front on Friday as the flow switches to the southwest. Strong winds and heavy snow will combine to produce localized blowing snow on Friday. Total snowfall accumulations of 20 to 30 cm are expected near White Pass through Friday afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T05:30:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T13:31:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3522461461.2021
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Resort Village Of Manitou Beach
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Resort Village of Manitou Beach. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Resort Village of Manitou Beach water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2021-01-22T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-01-14T07:37:03-06:00, 76142539-066A-E287-B4DE-147F54AF24CD
Area: Resort Village of Manitou Beach
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Update: Sasktel Service Outage Impacting Some Areas Of The Province
properties.Summary:
Description: UPDATE: SaskTel is anticipating service outages will continue over night and into tomorrow due to the extended commercial power outage, and lack of safe road conditions. Where it is safe to do so, SaskTel will continue to connect generators to our network sites and to high priority wireless sites to ensure services continue to operate normally. However, we anticipate there will be more service failures as our back-up batteries lose life and fail if we are unable to connect generators. Communities impacted include: Beechy, Elrose, Macoun, Kyle, Dinsmore. maxTV and internet services may also be impacted in areas around the province that still do not have commercial power.
Expires: 2021-01-15T09:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK SaskTel, 2021-01-14T17:46:45-06:00, B69613D8-6D78-7896-6365-77502950294D
Area: Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK SaskTel

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulates are expected and will result in poor air quality. High concentrations of pollutants are expected to diminish Thursday morning. ### Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-01-15T16:19:51-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant precipitation expected beginning Saturday night. Total snowfall: 15 cm or more for Northern New Brunswick. Total rainfall: 25 mm or more for areas near the Fundy coast. Locations: New Brunswick. Time span: Saturday night through to Sunday morning. Remarks: Snow is expected to spread across northern New Brunswick and rain across southern New Brunswick Saturday night. Snow and freezing rain are expected for central parts of the province Saturday night, changing to rain overnight. Conditions will begin to improve Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T19:11:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-15T03:12:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1583432509.2021
Area: Fredericton and Southern York County, Oromocto and Sunbury County, Grand Lake and Queens County, Sussex - Kennebecasis Valley and Kings County, Saint John and County, St. Stephen and Northern Charlotte County, Grand Manan and Coastal Charlotte County, Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Kent County, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Kouchibouguac National Park, Fundy National Park, Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway, Bathurst and Chaleur Region, Miramichi and area, Acadian Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. A frontal system approaching southern Yukon will spread snow at times heavy beginning early this evening. Snow will taper off overnight in the wake of the system. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T14:45:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T22:46:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3735858635.2021
Area: Teslin
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A frontal system approaching the northern Alaskan Panhandle today will spread snow at times heavy to the Haines Road this afternoon and continuing into early Friday morning. The heaviest snowfall accumulations of 30 to 40 cm are expected over the portion of the road from Pleasant Camp to the Chilkat Pass tonight. Snow will taper off to a few flurries overnight after the passage of the front. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T05:29:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T13:30:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1727768172.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Blowing snow, with poor visibility, is expected in the southern Red River Valley this afternoon and tonight. Snow and blowing snow is occurring in parts of southern and western Manitoba. Areas near the international border, such as Gretna, Altona, and Morden, will experience periods of poor visibility in snow and blowing snow this afternoon and tonight. Conditions will improve on Friday. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T08:04:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T16:05:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1228663661.2021
Area: R.M. of Morris incl. Rosenort and Aubigny, R.M. of Thompson incl. Miami Rosebank and Deerwood, R.M. of Roland incl. Jordan and Myrtle, R.M. of Montcalm incl. St. Jean Baptiste, Mun. of Rhineland incl. Altona Plum Coulee and Gretna, R.M. of Stanley incl. Winkler and Morden
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for a heavy snowfall event this weekend. Snow is forecast to begin overnight Friday as a strong low pressure system approaches Eastern Ontario from New England. This snow may then become heavy through the day Saturday and continue into Saturday night before easing Sunday. Significant snowfall amounts of 15 to 25 cm are possible by Sunday morning. Hazardous winter driving conditions are expected from this snowstorm. Motorists are advised to change travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T12:15:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T20:16:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2319673633.2021
Area: Gatineau, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Brockville - Prescott, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Prescott and Russell, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orléans, Ottawa South - Richmond - Metcalfe
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A frontal system approaching the northern Alaska Panhandle tonight will spread snow at times heavy to the Haines Road and South Klondike Highway. For the Haines Road, snowfall accumulations of 30 to 40 cm are expected from Pleasant Camp to Chilkat Pass tonight. Snow will taper off to a few flurries overnight after the passage of the front. Local blowing snow is possible tonight especially near Chilkat Pass. For the South Klondike Highway, snow will intensify in the wake of the front on Friday as the flow switches to the southwest. Strong winds and heavy snow will combine to produce localized blowing snow on Friday. Total snowfall accumulations of 20 to 30 cm are expected near White Pass through Friday afternoon. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T16:07:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-15T00:08:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3281342055.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard near the Richardson mountains overnight tonight and Friday. Very strong easterly winds will develop near the Richardson mountains overnight as an intense frontal system approaches. Peak winds of 90 gusting 110 km/h can be expected early Friday morning. These winds will combine with loose snow on the ground to produce blizzard conditions through Friday afternoon. Conditions are expected to improve late Friday as the winds ease in the wake of the front. ### Travel is expected to be very difficult or impossible due to near-zero visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T14:51:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T22:52:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3365154162.2021
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. A frontal system approaching southern Yukon will spread snow at times heavy beginning early this evening. Snow will taper off overnight in the wake of the system. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T14:45:06-00:00

Area: Haines Junction, Whitehorse, Teslin
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. More snow will fall tonight across northern Manitoba, with 10 cm total. Snow is falling over much of northern Manitoba, and the heaviest snow is expected from Leaf Rapids to Gillam. The snow will end later this evening over western areas and tonight near Gillam. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T08:34:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-14T21:05:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3642749340.2021
Area: Lynn Lake, Leaf Rapids, Pukatawagan, South Indian Lake and Amisk Prov. Park, Split Lake and York Landing, Thompson Thicket Portage and Pikwitonei, Nelson House, Gillam
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected for Friday. Locations: eastern Avalon peninsula. Snowfall amounts: near 15 cm. Time span: overnight tonight until early Friday afternoon. Remarks: the heaviest snow is expected to fall early Friday morning creating hazardous travelling conditions. The highest snowfall amounts are expected over southeastern Avalon and the Southern Shore. Snow should taper to flurries in the afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. There may be a significant impact on rush hour traffic in urban areas. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-15T18:00:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-15T02:01:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2351182864.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southeast winds from 80 to 100 km/h will ease this evening. An intense frontal system is giving very strong winds across the north coast, central coast, and northern Vancouver Island. This evening, the system will move into the BC interior and away from the coastal regions. Following the passage of the front, the winds will shift to 50 to 70 km/h from the southwest. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-15T09:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-15T00:12:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0457183880.2021
